data.title: December 2022 Issue of JAMA Network Open
data.meta_description: Read the December 2022 issue. Volume 5, Number 12
data.text:
INFECTIOUS DISEASES

Efficacy and Safety of Pacritinib vs Placebo for Patients With Severe COVID-19: A Phase 2 Randomized Clinical Trial

John Cafardi, MD; Carole Miller, MD; Howard Terebelo, DO; et al.

This randomized clinical trial evaluates the efficacy and safety of pacritinib vs placebo in the treatment of adults with severe COVID-19.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2242918. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.42918

ONCOLOGY

Yield of Surveillance Imaging After Mastectomy With or Without Reconstruction for Patients With Prior Breast Cancer: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis

Daniel Smith, PhD; Setara Sepehr, MD; Andreas Karakatsanis, MD, PhD; et al.

This meta-analysis investigates the usefulness of imaging surveillance in terms of cancer detection and interval cancer rates after mastectomy with or without reconstruction for patients with prior breast cancer.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244212. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44212

PUBLIC HEALTH

Association of Initial SARS-CoV-2 Test Positivity With Patient-Reported Well-being 3 Months After a Symptomatic Illness

Lauren E. Wisk, PhD; Michael A. Gottlieb, MD; Erica S. Spatz, MD, MHS; et al.

This cohort study compares patient-reported physical, mental, and social well-being at 3 months after symptomatic illness among adults with positive vs negative test results for SARS-CoV-2 infection.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244486. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44486

PUBLIC HEALTH

Effect of Wearing Glasses on Risk of Infection With SARS-CoV-2 in the Community: A Randomized Clinical Trial

Atle Fretheim, MD, PhD; Ingeborg Hess Elgersma, MA; Arnfinn Helleve, PhD; et al.

This randomized clinical trial evaluates the effectiveness of wearing glasses in public as protection against being infected with SARS-CoV-2 and other respiratory viruses.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244495. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44495

INFECTIOUS DISEASES

Association of Remdesivir Treatment With Mortality Among Hospitalized Adults With COVID-19 in the United States

Anand P. Chokkalingam, PhD; Jennifer Hayden, MS; Jason D. Goldman, MD, MPH; et al.

This comparative effectiveness study uses health insurance claims data linked to hospital chargemaster data to evaluate the association of remdesivir treatment with inpatient mortality among patients with COVID-19 outside of the clinical trial setting.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244505. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44505

ANESTHESIOLOGY

Effect of Intraoperative Esketamine Infusion on Postoperative Sleep Disturbance After Gynecological Laparoscopy: A Randomized Clinical Trial

Di Qiu, MD; Xing-Ming Wang, MD, PhD; Jin-Jin Yang, MD; et al.

This randomized clinical trial examines the effect of intraoperative esketamine infusion on incidence of sleep disturbance following gynecological laparoscopic surgery.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244514. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44514

ONCOLOGY

Evaluation of Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy for Survival Outcomes in Patients With Synchronous Oligometastatic Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma

Zhenguo Shi, MD; Xiaojuan Zhu, MD; Changli Ruan, MD; et al.

This prognostic study evaluates the outcomes of concurrent chemoradiotherapy and constructs decision tree models for predicting the risk of progression and mortality in patients with synchronous oligometastatic esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC).

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244619. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44619

PSYCHIATRY

Association of Outpatient Behavioral Health Treatment With Medical and Pharmacy Costs in the First 27 Months Following a New Behavioral Health Diagnosis in the US

Johanna Bellon, PhD; Carol Quinlan, MPH; Beth Taylor, PhD; et al.

This cohort study investigates the association of outpatient behavioral health treatment with 15- and 27-month medical and pharmacy costs among US individuals with a newly diagnosed behavioral health condition.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244644. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44644

DIABETES AND ENDOCRINOLOGY

Association of Glucose-Lowering Drugs With Outcomes in Patients With Diabetes Before Hospitalization for COVID-19: A Systematic Review and Network Meta-analysis

Zheng Zhu, MS; Qingya Zeng, MS; Qinyu Liu, MD; et al.

This meta-analysis reviews the associations between different glucose-lowering therapies and outcomes among patients with diabetes who received therapy before being hospitalized with COVID-19.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244652. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44652

MEDICAL EDUCATION

Implementation of an Online Reporting System to Identify Unprofessional Behaviors and Mistreatment Directed at Trainees at an Academic Medical Center

I. Michael Leitman, MD; David Muller, MD; Sophie Miller, BA; et al.

This cohort study evaluates the implementation of an online reporting system to identify unprofessional behaviors and mistreatment directed at trainees at an academic medical center.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244661. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44661

HEALTH POLICY

Comparison of Uptake and Prices of Biosimilars in the US, Germany, and Switzerland

David L. Carl, MSc; Yannic Laube, BA; Miquel Serra-Burriel, PhD; et al.

This cohort study compares uptake and prices of biosimilars in the US with those of Germany and Switzerland and assesses whether biosimilar awareness increased in each country over the last decade.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244670. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44670

OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH

Characterization of Problematic Alcohol Use Among Physicians: A Systematic Review

Janet Wilson; Peter Tanuseputro, MD, MHSc; Daniel T. Myran, MD; et al.

This systematic review examines the extent of problematic alcohol use in physicians and how it differs by sex, age, medical specialty, and career stage in 31 studies from 17 countries.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244679. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44679

INFECTIOUS DISEASES

Effectiveness of an Intervention to Improve HIV Service Delivery for People Who Inject Drugs in Kazakhstan: A Cluster Trial

Nabila El-Bassel, PhD; Tara McCrimmon, MPH; Elwin Wu, PhD; et al.

This cluster trial examines the effectiveness of the Bridge HIV care continuum intervention implemented in needle and syringe programs for people who inject drugs in Kazakhstan.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244734. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44734

PEDIATRICS

Safety and Short-term Outcomes of High-Dose Erythropoietin in Preterm Infants With Intraventricular Hemorrhage: The EpoRepair Randomized Clinical Trial

Sven Wellmann, MD; Cornelia F. Hagmann, MD, PhD; Stefanie von Felten, PhD; et al.

This preliminary report of a randomized clinical trial assess the safety and short-term outcomes of high-dose erythropoietin in preterm infants with intraventricular hemorrhage.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244744. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44744

IMAGING

Association of Maternal and Child Anemia With Brain Structure in Early Life in South Africa

Catherine J. Wedderburn, MRCPCH; Jessica E. Ringshaw, MA; Kirsten A. Donald, PhD; et al.

This cohort study investigates associations of anemia during pregnancy and postnatal child anemia with brain structure among children aged 2 to 3 years.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244772. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44772

NEUROLOGY

Association of Psychosocial Stress With Risk of Acute Stroke

Catriona Reddin, MB; Robert Murphy, MB; Graeme J. Hankey, MD; et al.

This case-control study evaluates the associations of different psychosocial stressors with the risk of stroke in different populations and assesses whether factors such as locus of control are associated with modified risk.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244836. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44836

ONCOLOGY

Association of Adherence to Endocrine Therapy Among Patients With Breast Cancer and Potential Drug-Drug Interactions

Elie Rassy, MD, MPH; Aur√©lie Bardet, PhD; Omar Bougacha, PhD; et al.

This cohort study of patients prescribed endocrine therapy for breast cancer examines the association of potential drug-drug interactions with therapy adherence.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244849. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44849

PEDIATRICS

Therapeutic Effects of Butyrate on Pediatric Obesity: A Randomized Clinical Trial

Serena Coppola, RD; Rita Nocerino, RN; Lorella Paparo, PhD; et al.

This randomized clinical trial examines the use of butyrate supplementation in addition to standard care in children with obesity.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244912. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44912

SUBSTANCE USE AND ADDICTION

Association of Recreational Cannabis Legalization With Cannabis Possession Arrest Rates in the US

Christian Gunadi, PhD; Yuyan Shi, PhD

This cross-sectional study examines whether recreational cannabis legalization was associated with changes in cannabis possession arrest rates in the US between 2010 and 2019, including by state decriminalization status and by age and race.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244922. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44922

HEALTH POLICY

Changes in Racial Equity Associated With Participation in the Bundled Payments for Care Improvement Advanced Program

Gmerice Hammond, MD, MPH; E. John Orav, PhD; Jie Zheng, PhD; et al.

This cohort study compares outcomes and access to care between Black and White patients following implementation of the Medicare Bundled Payments for Care Improvement‚ÄìAdvanced program.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244959. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44959

GERIATRICS

Effect of a Patient Decision Aid on Preferences for Colorectal Cancer Screening Among Older Adults: A Secondary Analysis of a Randomized Clinical Trial

Alexandra F. Dalton, PhD; Carol E. Golin, MD; Carolyn Morris, MPH; et al.

This secondary analysis of a randomized clinical trial assesses whether a patient decision aid that informs patients about the potential harms would decrease preferences in favor of colorectal cancer screening among older adults unlikely to benefit from it.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2244982. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.44982

ONCOLOGY

Concordance Between Recommendations From Multidisciplinary Molecular Tumor Boards and Central Consensus for Cancer Treatment in Japan

Yoichi Naito, MD; Kuniko Sunami, MD, PhD; Hidenori Kage, MD, PhD; et al.

This quality improvement study compares concordance between the recommendations for cancer treatment between independent molecular tumor boards and a central committee.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245081. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45081

INFECTIOUS DISEASES

Incidence of Viral Rebound After Treatment With Nirmatrelvir-Ritonavir and Molnupiravir

Grace Lai-Hung Wong, MD; Terry Cheuk-Fung Yip, PhD; Mandy Sze-Man Lai, BSc; et al.

This cohort study of patients with COVID-19 compares the incidence rates of viral rebound in patients with COVID-19 treated with molnupiravir or nirmatrelvir-ritonavir.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245086. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45086

OBSTETRICS AND GYNECOLOGY

Computed Tomographic Radiomics in Differentiating Histologic Subtypes of Epithelial Ovarian Carcinoma

Mandi Wang, PhD; Jose A. U. Perucho, PhD; Yangling Hu, MMed; et al.

This diagnostic study of women with epithelial ovarian carcinoma assesses whether computed tomography‚Äìbased radiomic features can differentiate histologic subtypes of epithelial ovarian carcinoma.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245141. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45141

INFECTIOUS DISEASES

Race and Ethnicity and Sex Variation in COVID-19 Mortality Risks Among Adults Experiencing Homelessness in Los Angeles County, California

Natalie A. C. Porter, MPH; Hannah K. Brosnan, MPH; Alicia H. Chang, MD, MS; et al.

This cross-sectional study examines variation by race, ethnicity, and sex of mortality rates of people experiencing homelessness who develop COVID-19 compared with the general population.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245263. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45263

ONCOLOGY

Melanoma Treatments and Mortality Rate Trends in the US, 1975 to 2019

Navkirat Kahlon, MD, MPH; Sishir Doddi, BS; Rame Yousif, BS; et al.

This cross-sectional study uses the Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results database to identify trends in the melanoma mortality rate among US adults from 1975 and 2019 and assess whether a change in the epidemiology of melanoma is associated with the advent of new and effective treatment options.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245269. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45269

PSYCHIATRY

Effect of Problem-solving Treatment on Self-reported Disability Among Veterans With Gulf War Illness: A Randomized Clinical Trial

Lisa M. McAndrew, PhD; Karen S. Quigley, PhD; Shou-En Lu, PhD; et al.

This randomized clinical trial of veterans with Gulf War illness examines whether problem-solving treatment is efficacious in reducing disability and problem-solving impairment.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245272. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45272

GERIATRICS

Infections, Hospitalizations, and Deaths Among US Nursing Home Residents With vs Without a SARS-CoV-2 Vaccine Booster

Kevin W. McConeghy, PharmD, MS; Barbara Bardenheier, MPH, PhD; Andrew W. Huang, MS; et al.

This cohort study uses a target trial emulation approach to estimate the vaccine effectiveness of a SARS-CoV-2 mRNA booster dose in preventing infection, hospitalization, and death among nursing home residents in the US.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245417. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45417

GASTROENTEROLOGY AND HEPATOLOGY

Characteristics and Treatment Rate of Patients With Hepatitis C Virus Infection in the Direct-Acting Antiviral Era and During the COVID-19 Pandemic in the United States

Vy H. Nguyen, BA; Leslie Kam, MD; Yee Hui Yeo, MD, MSc; et al.

This cohort study evaluates hepatitis C virus (HCV) treatment rates and patient characteristics associated with treatment in the era of direct-acting antivirals and during the COVID-19 pandemic.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245424. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45424

CRITICAL CARE MEDICINE

Appropriateness of Initial Course of Action in the Management of Blunt Trauma Based on a Diagnostic Workup Including an Extended Ultrasonography Scan

Fanny Planquart, MD; Emmanuel Marcaggi, MD; Raiko Blondonnet, MD; et al.

This cohort study of patients with blunt trauma treated at 6 French trauma centers uses an expert panel evaluation to examine the appropriateness of trauma care decision-making following use of extended sonography assessment in clinical workups.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245432. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45432

CARDIOLOGY

Effect of a Multicomponent Intervention Delivered on a Web-Based Platform on Hypertension Control: A Cluster Randomized Clinical Trial

Haoqi Zhou, PhD; Xin Wang, MD; Ying Yang, MD; et al.

This cluster randomized clinical trial examines the effect of a web-based intervention on hypertension management in China.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245439. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45439

PEDIATRICS

Effect of Early High-Dose Recombinant Human Erythropoietin on Behavior and Quality of Life in Children Aged 5 Years Born Very Preterm: Secondary Analysis of a Randomized Clinical Trial

Eleonora Picotti, MD; Tilman Reinelt, Dr rer nat; Brigitte Koller, MSP; et al.

This "prespecified secondary analysis of a randomized clinical trial investigates whether early high-dose recombinant human erythropoietin is associated with improved behavioral outcomes and health-related quality of life at age 5 years in children born very preterm.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245499. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45499

ONCOLOGY

Association of Smoking, Comorbidity, Clinical Stage, and Treatment Intent With Socioeconomic Differences in Survival After Oropharyngeal Squamous Cell Carcinoma in Denmark

Maja Halgren Olsen, MSc; Kirsten Frederiksen, MSc, PhD; Pernille Lassen, MD, PhD; et al.

This cohort study investigates socioeconomic differences in survival after oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma according to human papillomavirus status and the extent to which smoking, comorbidity, clinical stage, and treatment intent explain the survival gap.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245510. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45510

HEALTH POLICY

Federal Funding and Citation Metrics of US Biomedical Researchers, 1996 to 2022

John P. A. Ioannidis, MD, DSc; Iztok Hozo, PhD; Benjamin Djulbegovic, MD, PhD

This survey study evaluates the association between federal funding and citation metrics of US biomedical researchers from 1996 to 2022.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245590. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45590

ONCOLOGY

Association of Immune-Related Adverse Events, Hospitalization, and Therapy Resumption With Survival Among Patients With Metastatic Melanoma Receiving Single-Agent or Combination Immunotherapy

Alexander S. Watson, MD, DPhil; Siddhartha Goutam, MD; Igor Stukalin, MD; et al.

This cohort study examines the association between immune-related adverse events and survival among patients with metastatic melanoma, in particular for those receiving combination immune checkpoint blockade.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245596. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45596

ETHICS

Conceptualization of Surrogate Decision-making Among Spokespersons for Chronically Ill Patients

Lauren J. Van Scoy, MD; Michael J. Green, MD, MS; Theresa Smith, RN; et al.

This qualitative study examines how patient spokespersons distinguish surrogate decision-making from patient advocacy.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245608. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45608

HEALTH POLICY

Evaluation of Telehealth Visit Attendance After Implementation of a Patient Navigator Program

Oren J Mechanic, MD, MPH; Emma M. Lee, BA; Heidi M. Sheehan, MA, MS; et al.

This quality improvement study evaluates the implementation of a patient navigator pilot program to increase attendance at telehealth visits.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245615. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45615

STATISTICS AND RESEARCH METHODS

Longitudinal Assessment of Labor Market Earnings Among Patients Diagnosed With Cancer in Canada

Young Jung, PhD; Christopher Longo, PhD; Emile Tompa, PhD

This cohort study assesses changes in labor market earnings associated with cancer diagnosis stratified by cancer type and age among Canadians diagnosed with cancer from 1992 to 2008.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245717. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45717

CARDIOLOGY

Association of Lipoprotein(a) Levels With Incidence of Major Adverse Limb Events

Alexis F. Gu√©don, MD, MPH; Jean-Baptiste De Freminville, MD, MSc; Tristan Mirault, MD, PhD; et al.

This cohort study investigates whether lipoprotein(a) values are associated with lower-limb amputation or revascularization.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245720. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45720

ONCOLOGY

Association of Pack-Years of Cigarette Smoking With Survival and Tumor Progression Among Patients Treated With Chemoradiation for Head and Neck Cancer

Sung Jun Ma, MD; Han Yu, PhD; Brian Yu, BSc; et al.

This cohort study evaluates the association of pack-years of cigarette smoking with survival and tumor progression among patients treated with chemoradiation for head and neck cancer.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245818. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45818

PEDIATRICS

Incidence of and Neurodevelopmental Outcomes After Late-Onset Meningitis Among Children Born Extremely Preterm

Jane E. Brumbaugh, MD; Edward F. Bell, MD; Barbara T. Do, MSPH; et al.

This cohort study reports the incidence of late-onset meningitis during birth hospitalization of neonates born extremely preterm and the neurodevelopmental outcomes at 18 to 26 months‚Äô corrected age.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245826. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45826

GENETICS AND GENOMICS

Whole-Exome Sequencing Among Chinese Patients With Hereditary Diffuse Gastric Cancer

Ze-Xian Liu, PhD; Xiao-Long Zhang, MS; Qi Zhao, PhD; et al.

This cohort study uses whole-exome and targeted sequencing to assess the incidence rate of CDH1 germline alterations in hereditary diffuse gastric cancer, provide a genetic landscape for the disease, and identify new susceptibility genes among Chinese patients with hereditary diffuse gastric cancer.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245836. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45836

MEDICAL JOURNALS AND PUBLISHING

Comparison of Clinical Study Results Reported in medRxiv Preprints vs Peer-reviewed Journal Articles

Guneet Janda, BS; Vishal Khetpal, MD; Xiaoting Shi, BMedSci; et al.

This cross-sectional study of preprints compares the agreement in characteristics, results, and conclusions of clinical studies posted as preprints to medRxiv and subsequently published in any peer-reviewed journal.

has audio

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245847. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45847

Audio: Clinical Study Results Reported in medRxiv Preprints vs Peer-reviewed Journals

DIABETES AND ENDOCRINOLOGY

Comparison of Mitochondrial Adenosine Triphosphate‚ÄìSensitive Potassium Channel High- vs Low-Affinity Sulfonylureas and Cardiovascular Outcomes in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Treated With Metformin

Meng-Ting Wang, PhD; Hsueh-Yi Pan, MS; Ya-Ling Huang, RPh, MS; et al.

This cohort study evaluates the association between mitochondrial adenosine triphosphate‚Äìsensitive potassium (KATP) channel high- vs low-affinity sulfonylureas and cardiovascular outcomes in patients with type 2 diabetes treated with metformin.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245854. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45854

PUBLIC HEALTH

Trends in Risk Factors and Symptoms Associated With SARS-CoV-2 and Rhinovirus Test Positivity in King County, Washington, June 2020 to July 2022

Chelsea Hansen, MPH; Amanda C. Perofsky, PhD; Roy Burstein, PhD; et al.

This case-control study evaluates how risk factors and symptoms associated with SARS-CoV-2 test positivity have changed over the course of the pandemic among individuals in King County, Washington, and compares these with the risk factors associated with rhinovirus test positivity.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245861. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45861

SUBSTANCE USE AND ADDICTION

Tobacco Use and Incidence of Adverse Oral Health Outcomes Among US Adults in the Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health Study

Marushka L. Silveira, BDS, MPH, PhD; Colm D. Everard, PhD; Eva Sharma, PhD; et al.

This cohort study examines associations between tobacco product use and incidence of adverse oral health outcomes among US adults in the Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245909. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45909

ONCOLOGY

Cost-effectiveness of Axicabtagene Ciloleucel and Tisagenlecleucel as Second-line or Later Therapy in Relapsed or Refractory Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma

Jee H. Choe, MS; Hisham Abdel-Azim, MD; William V. Padula, PhD; et al.

This economic evaluation assesses the cost-effectiveness of axicabtagene ciloleucel and tisagenlecleucel vs standard care as second-line or later therapy for relapsed or refractory diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245956. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45956

HEALTH POLICY

Use of a Novel Network-Based Linchpin Score to Characterize Accessibility to the Oncology Physician Workforce in the United States

Erika L. Moen, PhD; Gabriel A. Brooks, MD, MPH; A. James O‚ÄôMalley, PhD; et al.

This cross-sectional applies the linchpin score, a measure of patient-sharing network vulnerability, to oncologists in the US from 2016 to 2018 to assess variation in network vulnerability across hospital referral regions.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2245995. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.45995

HEALTH POLICY

Coverage and Equity of Childhood Vaccines in China

Haijun Zhang, MSc; Xiaozhen Lai, BA; Joshua Mak, MPH; et al.

This cross-sectional study investigates coverage rates and equity of childhood vaccines in China in 2019.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2246005. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.46005

HEALTH POLICY

Comparison of Care Quality Metrics in 2-Sided Risk Medicare Advantage vs Fee-for-Service Medicare Programs

Kenneth Cohen, MD; Omid Ameli, MD, DrPH; Christine E. Chaisson, MPH; et al.

This cohort study compares the performance of the 2-sided risk Medicare Advantage model of care with that of fee-for-service Medicare among enrollees and their physicians.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2246064. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.46064

GLOBAL HEALTH

Clinical Characteristics and Outcomes of Patients Hospitalized With COVID-19 During the First 4 Waves in Zambia

Peter A. Minchella, PhD; Duncan Chanda, MBChB; Jonas Z. Hines, MD; et al.

This cohort study examines patient characteristics and risk factors for in-hospital death among patients admitted to COVID-19 treatment centers in Zambia during the COVID-19 epidemic.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2246152. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.46152

INFECTIOUS DISEASES

Effect of a Multisectoral Agricultural Intervention on HIV Health Outcomes Among Adults in Kenya: A Cluster Randomized Clinical Trial

Craig R. Cohen, MD; Elly Weke, MS; Edward A. Frongillo, PhD; et al.

This cluster randomized clinical trial assesses whether a multisectoral agricultural livelihood intervention improves viral load suppression, reduces food insecurity, and improves nutrition, mental health, and empowerment indicators among people living with HIV in sub-Saharan Africa.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2246158. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.46158

RHEUMATOLOGY

Factors Associated With Quality Care Among Adults With Rheumatoid Arthritis

Anne V. Seyferth, BS; Meghan N. Cichocki, BS; Chien-Wei Wang, MD; et al.

This cohort study assesses the prevalence of meeting successive markers of quality care for individuals with rheumatoid arthritis and characteristics associated with meeting these markers.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2246299. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.46299

ONCOLOGY

Association Between Genetic Risk, Adherence to Healthy Lifestyle Behavior, and Thyroid Cancer Risk

Xiuming Feng, MS; Fei Wang, PhD; Wenjun Yang, MS; et al.

This cohort study examines whether a healthy lifestyle affects the association between genetic variants and risk of thyroid cancer.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2246311. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.46311

CARDIOLOGY

Assessment of Depression and Adherence to Guideline-Directed Medical Therapies Following Percutaneous Coronary Intervention

Matthew E. Lapa, MD; Gretchen M. Swabe, MS; Bruce L. Rollman, MD; et al.

This cohort study evaluates the association of depression with 12-month adherence to guideline-directed medical therapies following percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2246317. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.46317

PEDIATRICS

Frequency of Acute Kidney Injury and Association With Mortality Among Extremely Preterm Infants

Khyzer B. Aziz, MD; Eric M. Schles, MS; Kartikeya Makker, MBBS; et al.

This cohort study examines the frequency and markers of acute kidney injury in extremely low-birth-weight and extremely preterm infants.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2246327. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.46327

ONCOLOGY

Analysis of Human Leukocyte Antigen DR Alleles, Immune-Related Adverse Events, and Survival Associated With Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor Use Among Patients With Advanced Malignant Melanoma

Halis Kaan Akturk, MD; Kasey L. Couts, PhD; Erin E. Baschal, PhD; et al.

This case-control study examines the association between development of immune-related adverse events (irAEs) and response to therapy, survival, and human leukocyte antigen (HLA) class II genes in patients with advanced melanoma treated with immune checkpoint inhibitors (ICIs).

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2246400. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.46400

PUBLIC HEALTH

Assessment of the Accuracy of Firearm Injury Intent Coding at 3 US Hospitals

Matthew Miller, MD, ScD, MPH; Deborah Azrael, PhD; Ravali Yenduri, MPH; et al.

This cross-sectional study uses case-level electronic health records for 2008 to 2019 from 3 level I US trauma centers to assess intent coding accuracy in hospital data used for firearm injury surveillance.

JAMA Netw Open. 2022;5(12):e2246429. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2022.46429

PUBLIC HEALTH
